lead_paragraph: MUNOZ--Michael Henry, M.D.,64, passed away in the early morning hours of Tuesday, January 19, at his home in Woodcliff Lake, New Jersey. He was battling a rare blood disorder known as amyloidosis. Michael was born on February 14, 1951 at Fitkin Memorial Hospital in Neptune, New Jersey. He grew up in Colts Neck, New Jersey, where he helped his family run the Colts Neck General Store. He graduated from Peddie School, Syracuse University, and received his medical degree and Masters of Public Health from Harvard Medical School. He was a diplomat of the American Board of Ophthalmology, a Diplomat of the National Board of Medical Examiners, and a Fellow of The Academy of Ophthalmology. He was a Lieutenant in the United States Public Health Service. Michael had a large collection of comic books dating back to his childhood. He also was an avid collector of antique cars and frequently attended car shows. He enjoyed jazz, astronomy, and old war movies. He was predeceased by his parents, William and Frances Munoz, and his older brother, Eric Munoz, M.D. He is survived by his wife, Andrea Joy Munoz, their children, Daniel, Rachel, and William, his sister Wendy Lerrick, and numerous nieces, nephews, and cousins. Donations can be made to The Valley Chabad Friendship Circle of Woodcliff Lake, NJ or The Amyloidosis Foundation. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MUNOZ, MICHAEL HENRY, M.D.
